discourse_list.title: USDD Slips its Peg as TRX Tumbles

content.content: More bad news. As per the news articles USDD lost its peg yesterday. The TRON DAO Reserve, an organization set up to ensure USDD trades at dollar parity, has deployed $2 billion to help defend the USDD peg. But after more than 24 hours post capital deployment, USDD has still not been able to regain its peg. What a mess    The Defiant – 14 Jun 22    Uh-oh! Tron’s Stablecoin USDD Slips its Peg as TRX Tumbles - The Defiant Tron’s algorithmic stablecoin USDD appears to be in trouble despite recent moves from the Tron DAO to overcollateralize the token.  Est. reading time: 3 minutes          Crypto Briefing – 14 Jun 22    TRON’s USDD Stablecoin Still Below $1 Despite $2B Cash Injection TRON's USDD stablecoin is still trading under a dollar over 24 hours after the TRON DAO Reserve announced deploying $2 billion to defend its peg.  Est. reading time: 3 minutes

Yeah, if there is 2 billion dollars out there ready to buy 700 million usdd, this is not going to crash.  What I take away from this is that there are people going around trying to crash stablecoins and create another terra scenario.  But I don’t understand why they’re targeting usdd here.  The TRON dao seems to have the money to just arbitrage that price and make money off of them.

Could easily be FUD. Notwithstanding the merits of whether it will crash or not, look how easily this all gets manipulated by the press and likely by others (with an agenda no doubt). It’s scary because people have invested and when they hear this, given the present market, it is crushing.
Well guys, you know where to put your next short position before Citadel and BlackRock do it.

I agree that in some media they sell exaggerated and speculative news to sell, but Luna has already shown us that this large-scale algorithmic model does not work, trying to replicate that model is going straight to failure without going through reception
They just got impatient. Need to wait for USDD to hit the tens of billions level before crashing it.

To be fair history tends to repeat itself, of course Justin and his team I think are more capable and the MC is not that big, maybe if it grows too much in the market, this stablecoin might not stay. Stay safe folks

The main difference is they were smart enough to have stablecoins in their reserve to back their stablecoin.  In order to crash usdd, someone would have to crash usdc.  If usdc is somehow taken down, it would pretty much take down every stablecoin we know including DAI.  I think when USDD was launched, The Tron DAO already had raised lots of capital as a reserve.  They might take a loss if TRX gets shorted and loses value but unless they’re lying about what they have, they have plenty of ammo to protect USDD.
Hopefully this will be the case so that people do not lose their money, and do not have yet another catastrophic situation as an excuse for what we know.
What is odd is why they allowed the peg to stay so far down. If they have large reserves, they could just set a buy order at 0.995.
Probably a lot more going on behind the scenes.
I hope so. This also just makes the space look terrible. I think collectively we all have to fight that stigma that crypto and/or defi is too risky etc. and stuff like this does not help.
Is USDD fully collateralized?  I thought it some portion algo. If so its brittle

I think it is algorithmic but also  “over-collateralized” Aside from being backed by TRX, USDD is backed by stockpiles of Bitcoin (BTC) and Tether (USDT) holdings    finder.com – 7 Jun 22    USDD, an algorithmic stablecoin, is growing fast. Should investors worry... A week before Terra LUNA and UST collapsed, erasing $60 billion, a similar stablecoin by Tron launched and it’s gaining momentum. Here’s what investors should know.  Est. reading time: 3 minutes
Where have we heard that before?

(3) Watcher.Guru on Twitter: “JUST IN: Tether ($USDT) has been under a DDOS attack after receiving a ransom request.” / Twitter  image1091×500 51.7 KB  What is next team ? Let’s stay vigilant out there.
Thank God this attack was insignificant and did not harm the stablecoin market, which is the most important thing.
All this algo nonsense needs to faceplant
